title: Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles
summary: The poster discusses the influence of drug-polymer interactions on release kinetics in poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide-co-ethylene glycol (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles, highlighting their potential to improve encapsulation efficiency and provide precise control over nanocarrier characteristics. The presentation also mentions that antimicrobial resistance (AMR) is a significant global health issue that necessitates innovative drug delivery strategies.
methods: The text does not contain any specific methodological details or experimental procedures related to the research topic "Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles". The provided text appears to be an abstract or introduction section discussing the background and objectives of the study rather than describing its methodology.
results: The study investigates how drug-polymer interactions affect the release kinetics of Poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) nanoparticles and Polylactide-co-Glycolide (PLA)/Polyethylene Glycol (PEG) nanoparticles. The research aims to develop more effective drug delivery systems by optimizing these carrier properties.
